dt: {bc}a vertical structure incorporated into a building and enclosing a flue or flues that carry off smoke
{bc}the part of such a structure extending above a roof
{bc}a tube usually of glass placed around a flame (as of a lamp)
{bc}a narrow cleft or passage in rock
{bc}a tall column of rock on the ocean floor that is formed by the precipitation of minerals from superheated water issuing from a hydrothermal vent and rising through the column of rock

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}chiminee{/it}, from Late Latin {it}caminata{/it}, from Latin {it}caminus{/it} furnace, fireplace, from Greek {it}kaminos{/it}; perhaps akin to Greek {it}kamara{/it} vault
shortdef: a vertical structure incorporated into a building and enclosing a flue or flues that carry off smoke; especially : the part of such a structure extending above a roof

dt: {bc}a usually earthenware pipe placed at the top of a chimney

shortdef: a usually earthenware pipe placed at the top of a chimney

dt: {bc}a person whose occupation is cleaning soot from chimney flues

shortdef: a person whose occupation is cleaning soot from chimney flues —called also chimney sweeper

dt: {bc}a small sooty-gray swift ({it}Chaetura pelagica{/it}) with long narrow wings that often builds its nest inside an unused chimney

shortdef: a small sooty-gray swift (Chaetura pelagica) with long narrow wings that often builds its nest inside an unused chimney —called also chimney swallow

dt: {bc}a part of a wall that extends out into a room to cover a chimney

shortdef: a part of a wall that extends out into a room to cover a chimney

dt: {bc}the part of a chimney that is above the roof of a building
{bc}a tall chimney on a factory, ship, etc., for carrying smoke away

shortdef: the part of a chimney that is above the roof of a building
a tall chimney on a factory, ship, etc., for carrying smoke away

dt: {bc}to smoke a lot of cigarettes, cigars, etc.

shortdef: to smoke a lot of cigarettes, cigars, etc.
